title: Sound Opinions Show
teaser: The Bermuda Triangle: Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot remember bands they thought were destined for big things, but which disappeared with barely a trace.
contentencoded:
NEWS: 
• Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot report on a major overhaul to Jerry Garcia’s website. The jewel of the site is a free archive of over 15,000 Grateful Dead tracks (most recorded by fans of the band at concerts), plus other musical collaborations. The website also maintains the communal spirit of the band’s followers by including a virtual “Parking Lot.” 
• In other news, the song “Let It Go” from the Disney film “Frozen” has been downloaded more than half a million times without getting much radio play. Only six stations nationwide have played the song. The soundtrack is also topping the Billboard chart. 
• Lastly, a Harvard University professor claims to have a pill that could help people to develop perfect pitch. 
FEATURE:
Jim and Greg discuss The Bermuda Triangle of Rock. This is the mysterious phenomenon when your favorite band vanishes without a trace, leaving you wanting more. Some of the artists featured are Chicago rockers Loud Lucy, hip-hop duo Cannibal Ox, and orchestral electro-pop outfit Mellow. Listeners of the show also chime in with their picks, like UK’s alternative rock group Elastica, and troubled neo-soul artist D’Angelo. 
REVIEW:
Jim and Greg review Warpaint, the self-titled second album from L.A. quartet.
YOUR SOUND OPINIONS:
At the end of the show we hear comments from listeners.
